channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dear Simon Priscilla and Denise Corbin housing managers of Hackney wick could you please address this issue.Osborne road antisocial behaviour lime bike.You have decided or have struct a deal with the Lime bike company allocating 3 car parking spaces in Osborne road which is an absolute nightmare for the residents. How can you justify this decision taking up car space for Lime bikes that pay no insurance, no road tax, and not paying for car parking permit like I am, why are privileged. This is also causing ASB especially at the weekend. Why have Hackney council given Lime preferential treatment I am sick of moving these bikes out of my way because of the outrages decision you've made. I have been a resident in Osborne road for 25 years and never experience such disruption. I have always owned a car and I have always paid from 2012 for a parking permit yet the nuisance bike get everything for free. I have asked in the pass to have a designated parking space with a very valid reason and guess what you refused but, now you give LIME BIKES FREE Parking which is causing a nuisance. Whoever, thought this was a good idea perhaps you should have this going on outside your own home and see how you like it. Lastly they are also leaving bikes near peoples cars I came out one day to find a bike learning on peoples cars. I THINK YOU SHOULD REMOVE THIS IDEA IMMEDIATELY. Other boroughs are scrapping them completed because of the nuisance these bikes are causing is seen on TV las week. Good morning Britain. I will be showing pictures of these bikes on Good Morning Britian and explaing to them what an issue it is causing in this cul-da-sac . The users leave the bikes anywhere they feel like it, I have had to personally move bikes in order to get passed when driving my car and when walking out of my front door. Friday and Saturday nights are worse than a week day. Is there a deal thats been made with the company to allow this prefe., 25th August
item.description:
Dear Simon Priscilla and Denise Corbin housing managers of Hackney wick could you please address this issue.Osborne road antisocial behaviour lime bike.You have decided or have struct a deal with the Lime bike company allocating 3 car parking spaces in Osb

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foot path litter, dog mess bags , bottles etc, 25th August
item.description:
The foot path hasn’t been cleaned again. Needs regular cleaning and maintenance. Full of bottles, litter, rubbish dog mess bags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Edmunds Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hackney council authority please could you address this issue ongoing. The resident Daintry way E95JJ has built a extension to her property using wooden,flammable material outbuilding in the daintry way communal garden causing residents distress and annoyance because the shed is blocking resident sunlight out their living room and bedroom windows. Also the building material is causing a fire risk to the above property where the residence have a newborn baby which is quite concerning this has been reported to London fire brigade/building regs at Hackney council but still nothing is being done. Also the communal back garden fire exit escape door is being blocked by materials and large plant pots. Which the housing manager does not do per-duty incompetent.This is incompetent of Hackney council managers., 25th August
item.description:
Hackney council authority please could you address this issue ongoing. The resident Daintry way E95JJ has built a extension to her property using wooden,flammable material outbuilding in the daintry way communal garden

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Enforce leads on ALL dogs, 25th August
item.description:
Lots of dogs (nearly always large) consistently off-leads in and around the square. No respect for others/other dog owners and a huge increase in dog-mess because the owners conveniently can’t see where their dog is at all times.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out, 25th August
item.description:
Street light outside number 37 Hugh Street has been out for at least two weeks now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Hugh Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A resident keeps throwing his dog waste in the public recycling,general waste bin next to the bus stop on Osborne Road next to my back garden gate at 12 Inglesham Walk, London E9 5JS which in summer this causes a stench and a horrid smell of dog feces.if someone could please address this behavior. Hackney Council should put designated dog waste bins for this purpose not near someone's back garden fence. No, a resident cannot legally throw dog mess into a public bin located next to your garden gate in Hackney; this is considered a criminal offense of fly-tipping, as the bins are for public use and not private property for disposing of their dog's waste. If you wish to report this issue, you should contact Hackney Council or the police, as officers can issue a Fixed Penalty Notice or prosecute for the offense., 25th August
item.description:
A resident keeps throwing his dog waste in the public recycling,general waste bin next to the bus stop on Osborne Road next to my back garden gate at 12 Inglesham Walk, London E9 5JS which in summer this causes a stench and a horrid smell of dog feces.

item.title: Illegal Party - Agressive Shouting, 25th August
item.description:
Recurring loud music and agressive shouting in megaphone until 3:00 on weekend or sunday nights. The emanates from the park from large loudspeaker. Only a small group of people there illegally play the music disturbing hundreds of people Downs Park.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footpaths Across Hackney Downs, Hackney, London

item.title: Dead branch hanging from tree about to fall, 25th August
item.description:
There is a branch hanging from a tree on the pavement outside number 43 and 45. It is dead/dying compared with the rest of the tree and hanging vertically as it seems to have mostly snapped from the main branch. I It looks like it will break off completely soon and may cause injury or damage to people or cars underneath. It is a large branch. Please remove as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
